intro: Kleinia gypsophila, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Its unique appearance and ability to store water in its leaves make it well adapted to harsh, dry environments. Kleinia gypsophila is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking visual appeal and resilience.
